devdoc.author: David Yongjun Kim (@Powerstream3604)
devdoc.details: Account module contract that provides the account features and initialization of signer      compatible with EIP-1271 & EIP-4337

execute(address,uint256,bytes).details: This method executes the calldata coming from the EntryPoint.      Barz will make a call to this function for majority of typical execution(e.g. Swap, Token Transfer)

params._dest: Address of destination where the call will be forwarded to
params._func: Bytes of calldata to execute in the destination address
params._value: Amount of native coin the owner is willing to send(e.g. ETH, BNB)

executeBatch(address[],uint256[],bytes[].details: This method batch executes the calldata coming from the EntryPoint.      Barz will make a call to this function for majority of typical execution(e.g. Swap, Token Transfer)

params._dest: Array of addresses of destination where the call will be forwarded to
params._func: Array of bytes of calldata to execute in the destination address
params._value: Array of amount of native coin the owner is willing to send(e.g. ETH, BNB)

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: This method can only be called during the initialization or signature migration.      If the proxy contract was created without initialization, anyone can call initialize.      Barz calls initialize in constructor in an atomic transaction during deployment

params._anEntryPoint: Entrypoint contract defined in EIP-4337 handling the flow of UserOp
params._facetRegistry: Registry of Facets that hold all facet information

devdoc.title: Account Facet

constructor.notice: This constructor ensures that this contract can only be used as singleton for Proxy contracts

entryPoint().notice: Returns the address of EntryPoint contract registered to Barz account

execute(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Calls the destination with inputted calldata and value from EntryPoint

executeBatch(address[],uint256[],bytes[].notice: Batch calls the destination with inputted calldata and value from EntryPoint

getNonce().notice: Return the account nonce. This method returns the next sequential nonce. For a nonce of a specific key, use `entrypoint.getNonce(account, key)`

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: Initializes the initial storage of the Barz contract.

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.notice: Validate user's signature and nonce. subclass doesn't need to override this method. Instead, it should override the specific internal validation methods.
